description:
The erection of a new 5-7 storey building comprising
60 residential flats  6 Class A1-A3 retail units
3034sq.metres Class B1 office  389sq.m of Class B1c
workshop a 229 bedroom hotel with ancillary
conference  restaurant and bar facilities  a 4-screen
multiplex cinema  a health club and ancillary
basement carpark  service yard and plant rooms.
as shown on drawing no(s) 0011/PL/1A  2A 3A 4B-9B
10A-12A  13B-15B  16A-18A 20 21A 22B 23A 24A 25 26 27
as revised on 24.06.93 and 29.06.93.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - Full details, in elevation and section at a larger scale,
    showing fenestration, cornices, mansards, balconies and
    shop fronts shall be submitted to and approved by the
    Council before work on site is commenced

Condition : 3 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises, in
    particular in relation to the proposed shops, offices,
    workshops, cinema and hotel and conference facility shall
    be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the
    building and specifically within the service yard provided.

Condition : 4 - The shop(s) shall not be used for any purpose other than a
    purpose falling within Class A1 of the Schedule of the Town
    and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any
    provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory
    instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order.

Condition : 5 - The shop units 5 & 6 on the Greville Road frontage as shown
    on the ground floor plans hereby approved, shall not be
    used for Class A3 food and drink uses as defined by the
    Schedule of the Town & Country Planning ( Use Classes)
    Order 1987.

Condition : 6 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 8 - The new residential development shall comply with the
    Council's standards in respect of noise levels, ie that the
    average 18 hour L10 noise level within habitable rooms
    shall not exceed 45dBA.

Condition : 9 - No music shall be played in the hotel, conference facility,
    resturant or health club in such a way as to be audible
    within any adjoining residential accommodation.

Condition : 10 - Details of the proposed roof plant shall not be otherwise
    than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 11 - The new workshop units as shown on the first floor plans
    hereby approved shall be used only for Class B1c light
    industrial use and for no other purpose, (including any
    other purpose within Class B1 of the Schedule of the Town &
    Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any
    provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory
    instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order.

Condition : 12 - No pedestrain access/egress or loading/unloading of goods
    shall take place from Kilburn Priory into the proposed
    "function room" within the ground floor of the hotel.

Condition : 13 - Full access to the Classic Cinema and theatre shall be
    given to the London Division of English Heritage prior to
    demolition to enable records to be made of any items of
    architectural interest.

Condition : 14 - A works method statement to include infromation regarding
    the phasing timing and duration of works together with
    details of the plant and and equipment to be used, shall be
    submitted to and agreed by the Council prior to
    commencement of works on site.

Condition : 15 - The developer shall pay for the supply and implementation
    of five "Sheffield" cycle stands (at a maxium cost of
    #1000) to be installed on the footway and to be implemented
    as part of the highway reinstate- ment works carried out by
    the Chief Engineer.

Condition : 16 - The devloper shall make a new application for designated
    roads approval to the Traffic Director for London for the
    proposed taxi layby on Kilburn High Road.

Condition : 17 - The number of car spaces as shown on the two basement level
    plans hereby approved shall be no more than 110 in total
    and shall be allocated at the following maxiums levels for
    the various land uses and permanently retained as such:-
    Hotel and Conference room 25 spaces  Office and Workshop 4
    spaces  Residential 66 spaces  Health Club 2 spaces  Cinema
    7 spaces  Retail 6 spaces

Condition : 18 - The developement shall not be occupied until management
    scheme for thecarpark and servicing area has been submitted
    to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 19 - The whole of the carparking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 20 - A working party shall be established comprising
    representatives from the owners of the development, thier
    architects and contractors, relevant officers from the
    Council's Planning Transport & Health service and residents
    living in adjoining dwellings. The working party shall meet
    once a month to discuss issues relating to the demolition
    and construction of the new development
